des:
With the Safety 1st Connected skill for Alexa, you can let the sound of your voice control all of your connected nursery products. 

Fussy baby in one hand, bottle in the other and need some soothing lullabies to get the night going? “Alexa, turn on the Soother lullaby music”. Or maybe you forgot to turn on the humidifier but can’t risk going back into the nursery and waking up baby? “Alexa, turn on the Smart Humidifier” is all you need to say and you won’t dare need to brave the floor creaks. 


Getting started with Alexa is easy and can be done in a few simple steps:

Download the “Safety 1st Connected” app from the Apple App Store or Google Play Store, then create an account.

Pair one or more devices, making sure to select an appropriate name and room for each devices. This is what you’ll call them when asking Alexa.

Download Amazon "Alexa" app from Apple App Store or Google Play Store then configure your Echo device within the "Alexa" app;

Search for the “Safety 1st Connected” skill from the "Alexa" app skills category;

Enable the “Safety 1st Connected” skill, and you'll be navigated to our login page;

Follow the instructions on the page to complete linking;

Once enabled, you’ll be able to ask Alexa to control all of your Safety 1st Connected products! Have a question? Check out our in-app knowledgebase or submit a feedback ticket for additional support. 


Additional examples of what you can ask Alexa: 
“Alexa, show me Noah’s Baby Monitor.”
“Alexa, set the brightness of the Soother to 50%.”
“Alexa, dim the Under Crib Light to 40%.”
"Alexa, set Smart Humidifier humidity to 55%."
